2.heading: Targets.

notes: (Viz Graphic Novel)
(Mobile Suit Gundam Wing)
"Based on the anime TV series Mobile Suit Gundam Wing. Mobile Suit Gundam Wing created by Hajime Yatate & Yoshiyuki Tomino."

3.heading: Targets.
3.title: "Death Target" 6 p. in U.S. Tank Commandos, no. 3
3.author: [No author]

4.heading: Targets.
4.title: Doug's Big Comeback
4.author: created by Jim Jinkins ; adapted by Nancy E
4.appears_in: Krulik ; illustrated by Peter List, Cheng-li Chan, Tony Curanaj, Chris Dechert, Brian Donnelly, Ray Feldman, Chris Palesty, Matt Peters, and Jonathan Royce.
notes: (Disney Chapters)
"Jumbo Pictures."

Summary: Doug has always been the target of Roger's taunts, until lately he learned to put down Roger, and everyone is laughing. But now Doug just can't stop being Mr. Funny Guy at the expense of his friends' feelings, until he realizes the comeback remark isn't always as funny as it seems.

5.heading: Targets.
5.title: "Duel Target"* p. 30 in The Two Sombrheroes
5.author: artist, Pierre Tranchand ; writer, François Corteggiani (Ilidza, Yugoslavia : Strip Art Features, 1989).
notes: (Smith & Wesson ; v. 1)
Summary: Smith prepares for a gun duel by shooting at a target, and Wesson prepares by painting a target on Smith's opponent. Plate no. 203.

6.heading: Targets.
6.title: "He Was Amazed at My Ability to Hit Those Water Targets Every Time!"
6.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: A son admires his dad's golf trophy, which was actually given to him as a gag. "You got the highest score, dad!"

7.heading: Targets.
7.title: "He's a Touch Target from Now On"
7.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: Word is around that the Major has money, and his friends ask for loans to avoid the poorhouse, high bridges, and muscling in on the squirrels' peanuts in the park.

11.heading: Targets.
11.title: "I Wish I Could Be In Show Business"
11.author: [No author]
11.series: Toots) p. 105-106 in Bunty for Girls
notes: Summary: Toots tries singing, dancing, drama and mime without satisfactory results, and gives up when asked to be the target for a knife-thrower.

12.heading: Targets.
12.title: "Knife Throwing Act"* p. 29 in The Two Sombrheroes

notes: (Smith & Wesson ; v. 1)
Summary: Wesson tries to help out his friend Pedro with his new job, and ends up strapped to a target in a circus. Plate no. 181.

13.heading: Targets.
13.title: "Look Out, Benny!"
13.author: by A
notes: Summary: Benny tries to sneak into his apartment building, but becomes the target of a drive by shooting.

14.heading: Targets.

notes: SUMMARY: A limited atomic war, with television reconnaissance, one-man helicopters, and triphibious jeeps, is shortened by putting warheads instead of cameras in the surveillance drones. k. 53.heading: Tarn.
53.title: "Den II"
53.author: by Richard Corben
53.appears_in: p. 17-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 9 (Dec. 1981).
notes: "While searching for the queen's powerful stones, Den, Tarn, and the others came across the queens' guards and a pit chock full o' hungry reptiles. Once the stones were found, the group's almost futile effort to return to their ship proved nearly all for nought, when Den and the stones went tumbling off the side, as the ship took flight. Tarn, an eternal enemy of Den's, caught him and saved Den's life."

54.heading: Tarn.
54.title: "Den II"
54.author: by Richard Corben
54.appears_in: p. 39-42 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 11 (Feb. 1982).
notes: "The evil queen, having been unable to find the Nar stones, threw old Zeg out the window to his death. Meanwhile, Moda found the lost Tarn. But as they headed back home, they became lost in Muvovum."
"To be continued."

55.heading: Tarn.
55.title: "Den II"
55.author: by Richard Corben
55.appears_in: p. 84-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 12 (Mar. 1982).
notes: "Tarn, left alone by Moda, was attacked by a strange creature, who was in turn attacked by the unusual Muvovum folk. Now a prisoner, Tarn awoke in a cell with Moda. It looked like curtains for both of them."

56.heading: Tarn.
56.title: "Den II"
56.author: by Richard Corben
56.appears_in: p. 21-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 1 (Apr. 1982).
notes: "When we last saw Tarn and Moda, they were in the presence of Jord, the leader of the Muvovum people. He was accompanied by his pet, Jordella, who took an instant liking to Moda. Unfortunately, the feelings weren't mutual, and Moda threw Jordella to the ground. With that, the guards carried him off. The rest remains to be seen."
"To be continued."

57.heading: Tarn.
57.title: "Den II"
57.author: by Richard Corben
57.appears_in: p. 12-15 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 4 (July 1982).
notes: "When we last saw Tarn, he was tricked into making love by the creature Jordella, who had taken the form of Tarn's love, Muuta. After their lovemaking, the creature died, leaving poor Tarn sitting around wondering what was going to happen to him."

58.heading: Tarn.
58.title: "Den II"
58.author: by Richard Corben
58.appears_in: p. 73-76 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 5 (Aug. 1982).
notes: "When last we read, Tarn was attempting to kill himself, but was saved by a demon spirit. Meanwhile, Den, who had recently escaped a dreary, desert death, was battling with Zandor, a member of the Lorung tribe."
"To be continued."

59.heading: Tarn.
59.title: "Den II"
59.author: by Richard Corben
59.appears_in: p. 19-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 6 (Sept. 1982).
notes: "In our last issue, Den, who was living with the Lorung tribe, learned that Zeg was dead, Tarn had run away, and that Zegium was destroyed. Den left to search for Tran and avenge Zeg's death."
To be continued.

60.heading: Tarn.
60.title: "Den II"
60.author: by Richard Corben
60.appears_in: p. 19-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 7 (Oct. 1982).
notes: "Last issue: Den continued searching for his friend Tarn. He came upon a Dramite hive of colossal size and entered the seemingly abandoned structure."
"To be continued."

61.heading: Tarn.
61.title: "Den II"
61.author: by Richard Corben
61.appears_in: p. 78-85 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 10 (Jan. 1983).
notes: "Last we saw, Den and Muuta finally made it to Minimuut. While contemplating their next move, a Dramite messenger showed up. Soon after, the long lost Tarn returned."
"To be continued."

62.heading: Tarn.
62.title: "Den II"
62.author: Richard Corben
62.appears_in: p. 14-19 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 11 (Feb. 1983).
notes: "When last we read, Tarn, who had become the king of the Lorungan Mts. and the Knorland Forests, returned to take his bride, Muuta. Soon after his arrival, Den discovered the Dramites' evil plans, and he, Muuta and the rest of the Minimuutan people planned their escape."
"To be continued."

64.heading: Tarnation.
64.title: "Now Where in Tarnation Did These Come From?"

notes: Summary: Moira is suspected of faking footprints, she slams her door so they can't snoop in her room, and the gardener finds something the next morning.
